result.execSummary:
The defendant William B. Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment/30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for.

DNA sample unless already provided.
Completion of AODA assessment and follow through. 
Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
Participate in any counseling as deemed beneficial by agent.

supervisions.notes:
Huber Privileges.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence already received.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Comply with conditions as set forth in Ct. 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William B. Taylor

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
01:28 PM in Room 301. Defendant William B. Taylor in court with attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer.  Defendant William B. Taylor in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 21CF221 and 22CF14. State recites agreement Def. to plead to 22CF14: - Ct. 1 and 2. Ct. 3 and 4 to be DRI.    221 - Ct. 1 to be DRI.   Joint recommendation: 22CF14  Ct. 1 withhold sentence, 3 years probation, costs with DNA surcharge, sample, AODA and follow thru, maintain absolute sobriety, fulltime employment, counseling as deemed necessary.    Ct. 2 - imp/stayed 1 year jail,   3 years probation, comply with conditions in Ct. 1.  Attny Restemayer concurs. Def. wants to waive PH in 22CF14. Waiver of P.H. reviewed. Def. still wants to waive P.H. Court accepts waiver in 22CF14, finds probable cause and binds over for filing of Information. Informtion efiled. Attny Restemayer has copy, waives reading and will procede to plea. Plea questionnaire reviewed.   22CF14: Def. pleads to Ct. 1 - Bail jumping, repeater, guilty; Ct. 2 - Poss of Meth, repeater, guilty. Court grants State's motion to DRI Cts. 3 and 4 in 22CF14 and Ct. 1 in 21CF221. Constitutional rights, elements and possible penalties reviewed. Attny Restemayer is satisfied. Court finds that Def. understands and that pleas are freely and voluntarily given. Court finds there is a factual basis, accepts pleas and finds Def. guilty of Ct. 1 and Ct. 2. Sentencing remarks by State. Sentencing remarks by Attny Restemayer. Def. makes statement. Remarks by the Court. 
The Court will abide by agreement, orders  Ct. 1 - withhold sentence, 3 years probation, costs with DNA surcharge, DNA sample unless already provided, completion of AODA assessment and follow thru, maintain absolute sobriety,  maintain fulltime employment 30/hours week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for, participate in any counseling as deemed beneficial by agent.    Ct. 2 - imp/stayed 1 year jail, Huber, consecutive to any other sentence already received, 3 years probation, costs only including DNA surcharge and comply with conditions in Ct. 1. 
Credit:  22CF14 -  65 days credit if revoked.  $500 cash bond in 21CF221 to be returned to poster. Costs in 22CF14 to be paid during probation. Firearm/voting rights.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Post conviction rights.

02:32 PM Defendant William B. Taylor in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  William B. Taylor appeared by video means. All parties via zoom.  Court review history of case. Atty Zich makes special appearance. Def. doesn't know how to move forward with p.h.  Court will set for P.H. Bond modification needs to be in written form.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No illegal use or possession of controlled substances

01:38 PM Defendant William B. Taylor in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  William B. Taylor appeared by video means. All parties via zoom.   Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. is going to contact P.D. State gives bail/bond recommendation. Def. makes statement. Def. is not on probation. Def. can't post cash bond. Def. would like ankle bracelet.  Court orders $3,000 cash bond with condition No illegal use or possession of controlled substances. Court will reserve right to be heard on bond @ later date and needs to provide letter from grandparents and employer.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
